intro: Schoenoides, commonly known as the grass of Parnassus, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The genus includes several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants often thrive in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and woodland edges. Their botanical features make them valuable for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
